abstract: In August, a hedge fund controlled by Edward S. Lampert, the value-oriented billionaire investor, disclosed that it had built up a $1.3 billion stake in Citigroup, the beleaguered financial giant. At the time, Mr. Lampert’s quickly growing stake, backed by his reputation for finding bargains, prompted some to wonder whether Citi’s battered stock was ready for a rebound.
